name: Nancy Charlotte
appearance: A sweet and delicate young woman with a doll-like face and long golden curly hair reaching her hips. When seen by investigators, she is wearing a red woolen coat. While tending flowers, her focused and gentle demeanor gives her an almost angelic impression.
personality: Pure-hearted, kind, gentle, and emotionally vulnerable. Despite her traumatic upbringing, she remains sincere, trusting, and compassionate. She is easily hurt but capable of deep attachment and loyalty.
background: Nancy was born from a brief romance between parents of different nationalities during a vacation in Turkey. After her parents divorced when she was five, she was taken to France by her mother. Her mother later married a wealthy man who sexually harassed Nancy in secret; when Nancy told her mother, she was told to endure it for the sake of comfort. Eventually, Nancy was sent to a boarding school, where she met Simon Laplace, who became her first true friend. Her mother later joined the Black Goat cult and attempted to sacrifice Nancy. This led to a tragic train accident in France, followed by a violent confrontation in which Nancy’s mother was killed by Anatole, Simon’s alternate personality. Nancy was then taken to America by Simon and has since lived under constant threat from cult remnants.
goals: To live a peaceful and safe life free from persecution
To stay with and trust Simon, her protector and closest companion
secrets: Her mother was a member of the Black Goat cult and attempted to sacrifice her
Her survival is tied to a violent past involving murder and falsified identities

clues.clueText: Her mother joined the Black Goat cult and attempted to use her as a sacrifice.
She was protected and taken to America by Simon after a series of violent events in France.

relationships.description: Her closest companion and protector, whom she deeply trusts.
relationships.history: They met while Nancy was in a French boarding school; Simon saved her from cult persecution and brought her to America.

relationships.description: A cult that targeted her for sacrifice.
relationships.history: Her mother was indoctrinated into the cult and attempted to offer Nancy as a living sacrifice.

notes: Nancy is emotionally fragile but remains a symbol of innocence within the story. Her survival is a key emotional anchor for Simon and a recurring target for cult forces.
